description: Like 'ee' in 'cheese'. Lips spread wide like a smile, tongue high and forward.
Like the 'ay' in 'say' but without the 'y' glide. Tense, lips slightly spread.
Like the 'e' in 'bed'. Mouth open a bit more than for [e].
Like the 'a' in 'father', but further forward in the mouth.
A deeper, further back version of 'a', like a yawn. Common in some French accents.
Like the 'o' in 'port'. Lips are rounded and mouth is quite open.
Like the 'oa' in 'boat'. Lips are very rounded and tense.
Like the 'oo' in 'moon'. Lips pushed forward and tightly rounded.
Say 'ee' [i] but keep your lips tightly rounded like you're whistling.
Say 'ay' [e] but keep your lips rounded as if saying 'oh'.
Say 'eh' [ɛ] but keep your lips rounded. Mouth more open than for [ø].
A relaxed, neutral 'uh' sound. Like the 'a' in English 'sofa'.
The sound in 'vin' (wine). Make an 'eh' [ɛ] sound, but let air escape through your nose.
The sound in 'enfant' (child). Make an 'ah' [ɑ] sound, but through your nose. Drop your jaw.
The sound in 'bon' (good). Make an 'oh' [ɔ] sound, but through your nose. Round your lips.
The sound in 'parfum' (perfume). Make the sound [œ] (like in 'fleur'), but through your nose. The 'un' in 'brun'.
A puff of air from the lips, no voice. Like English 'p' but with less air.
A voiced sound from the lips. Like English 'b'.
Tongue tip on back of top teeth, no voice. Like English 't' but softer.
Tongue tip on back of top teeth, with voice. Like English 'd' but softer.
A hard sound from the back of the tongue, no voice. Like English 'k'.
A voiced, hard sound from the back of the tongue. Like English 'g' in 'go'.
Top teeth on bottom lip, blow air, no voice. Like English 'f'.
Top teeth on bottom lip, make a buzzing sound. Like English 'v'.
A hissing sound. Like English 's' in 'see'.
A buzzing sound. Like English 'z' in 'zoo'.
A 'shushing' sound. Like English 'sh' in 'shoe'.
Voiced 'sh' sound, like the 's' in English 'treasure'.
A humming sound with lips closed. Like English 'm'.
Tongue tip behind teeth, air through nose. Like English 'n'.
Like the 'ny' in 'canyon'. The middle of the tongue presses against the roof of the mouth.
A nasal sound from the back of the tongue, like 'ng' in English 'king'. Found in loanwords.
Tongue tip touches behind top teeth. Lighter than in English.
The French 'R'. A rattling/gargling sound made at the back of the throat (uvula).
A gliding sound, starts like 'ee' but moves. Like 'y' in English 'yes'.
A gliding sound with rounded lips, like 'w' in English 'we'.
A mix of [y] and [w]. Say 'ee' [i] with very tightly rounded lips, then glide.
